title: Five-judge Constitution Bench to decide if issue of limited promotional avenues for entry-level judicial officers warrants reference to larger Bench
content: The long-pending matter raises concerns over stagnation in career progression and disparities in pay and promotional opportunities among officers in the subordinate judiciary.

title: Prashant Kishor not to take on Tejashwi Yadav in Raghopur, Jan Suraaj Party names another candidate
content: JSP national president Uday Singh handed the party symbol to Chanchal Singh for Raghopur, an assembly seat in Vaishali district

title: Operation Chakra-V: CBI arrests three in operation targeting transnational cyber fraud network
content: Several unsuspecting individuals were deceitfully appointed as directors in these companies under the guise of part-time employment in e-commerce or fintech operations

title: Over 100 Pakistani casualties as a result of India’s decisive response to Pahalgam attack: Lt. Gen. Rajiv Ghai
content: Director General of Military Operations says Pakistan’s posthumous gallantry medals proves high number of casualties; says India achieved its political and military goals through targeted operations

title: Defence Minister calls for reformed multilateralism, upholding rules-based global order
content: Peacekeepers today face increasingly complex challenges, from volatile environments marked by terrorism to humanitarian crises, Rajnath Singh said at the Chiefs’ Conclave of the United Nations Troop Contributing Countries, being hosted by India for the first time

title: Supreme Court questions whether ED is overstepping in Tamil Nadu liquor-scam probe
content: For the second time in six months, the top court questions ED’s conduct in the case; “what happens to the federal structure,” asks CJI Gavai

title: Confusion continues in Mahagatbandhan
content: With no decision on the seat division between the allies, each party is busy clearing the names of its candidates to ensure that they do not miss the nomination deadline

title: Supreme Court’s observations on Mullaperiyar dam an injustice to T.N., says Vaiko
content: He condemns the Kerala government and Save Kerala Brigade for filing a petition seeking permission to demolish the dam

title: Crimes against women, children, and the elderly on the rise in the State: Nainar Nagenthran
content: He alleges that the ‘growing spread of narcotic drugs’ is the major reason for the rise in such criminal activities

title: Rekha Gupta, BJP’s only woman CM, to campaign extensively for Bihar Assembly election
content: The outcome of the Bihar election will depend heavily on voting by women, and Gupta is a good orator who connects with the audience through her straight talk, a party leader said

title: India to train border security force of Mongolia: PM Modi
content: The PM highlights common Buddhist bonds between Mongolia and India and says India will start issuing free e-visas for Mongolian citizens

title: CMC launches specialised team for patients affected with blood clot
content: According to a press release, the team was started to mark World Thrombosis Day, observed annually on October 13, and a global awareness campaign initiated by the International Society on Thrombosis and Haemostasis (ISTH) in 2014.

title: 61 Maoists, including top leader Bhupati, surrender in Maharashtra
content: A senior official said that with Bhupati’s surrender, “the core family of the Naxal movement” has ended and that it is a “major step in the elimination” of the insurgency

title: Two held as U.P. STF seizes liquor worth ₹60 lakh bound for poll-bound Bihar
content: Consignment of 537 cartons of Indian-made foreign liquor was being transported from Punjab in a truck with fake registration plates

title: Impleading victim’s parents is key to bail in POCSO Act cases, says Madurai Bench of Madras High Court
content: At the same time, the court has said it will be crucial to ensure that the victim is not made a party in any proceedings or applications. When the victim’s family or de facto complainant are impleaded, their identity and details should be protected

title: Discontent grows in JD(U) over ticket distribution, seat-sharing
content: JD(U) MP Ajay Kumar Mandal offers to resign while MLA Gopal Mandal sits in protest, both claiming that they are not allowed to meet Chief Minister Nitish Kumar; three leaders file nomination even before party releases candidate list; however, party working president Sanjay Jha says ‘all is well’ within the NDA.

title: 20 Killed After Bus Catches Fire On Jaisalmer-Jodhpur Highway
content: At least 20 people were killed when a private bus travelling from Jaisalmer to Jodhpur in Rajasthan caught fire on Tuesday, the police said.

title: "Very Unhappy": Trump Threatens Spain With Tariffs Over NATO Spending
content: President Donald Trump on Tuesday threatened trade penalties, including tariffs, against Spain, saying he is unhappy with its refusal to raise defense spending to 5% and calling the move disrespectful to NATO.

title: Trump Says "We Will Disarm" Hamas And It Will Happen "Perhaps Violently"
content: US President Donald Trump said Tuesday that "we will disarm" Hamas if the Palestinian militants refuse to do it themselves, as he called for the group to release the bodies of hostages.

title: In Telangana, KTR Accuses Congress Of "Vote Theft" In Detailed Presentation
content: Bharat Rashtra Samithi working president, KT Rama Rao, accused the ruling Congress of planning "massive electoral fraud" and "vote chori" in the upcoming Jubilee Hills Assembly by-election in Telangana.

title: US Stocks Dip As Trade Tensions With China Flare Up Again
content: Stocks slipped in morning trading on Wall Street Tuesday as trade tensions escalated again with China.

title: US State Department Employee Accused Of Removing Classified Documents, Meeting Chinese Officials
content: A US State Department employee has been accused of unlawfully removing classified documents from secure government locations and holding multiple meetings with Chinese officials dating back to 2023, Fox News reported.

title: Mother, 2 Others Charged In Death Of Child Found In Bin Outside US Home
content: The mother of a 12-year-old girl whose remains was found last week in a storage bin outside of an abandoned home in Connecticut has been charged in her death, along with her boyfriend and sister.

title: Madhya Pradesh High Court Orders Case Under NSA In Caste Humiliation Case
content: The Madhya Pradesh High Court in Jabalpur has taken a suo motu cognizance of the shocking caste humiliation incident in Sataria village of Damoh district, where an OBC man was forced to wash and drink water from an upper-caste person's feet.

title: UN Says Its Humanitarian Convoy Hit By Russian Drones In Ukraine
content: A United Nations humanitarian convoy was hit by Russian drones while delivering aid to a front-line area in southern Ukraine, the UN's Office for Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs in Ukraine said on social media.

title: Amid Tension In Gwalior, A Cop-Lawyer Face-Off With "Jai Shri Ram" Slogans
content: "Jai Shri Ram, Jai Shri Ram" -- the chant rang out loud in the heart of Gwalior this evening, as a heated confrontation unfolded between a police officer and a lawyer amid prohibitory orders and tightened security across the city.

title: At Least 16 Killed In Fire At Chemical And Garments Factory In Dhaka
content: At least 16 people were killed Tuesday when a fire tore through a chemical and garments factory in Bangladesh's capital Dhaka, officials said.

title: US Expects Support From India, Allies Against China's Rare Earth Curbs
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent revealed on Monday that Washington expects support from its allies and friends, including India, over its attempt to counter China's latest export controls on rare earths.

title: London Mosque Barring Women From Charity Run 'Unacceptable': Minister
content: UK Communities Secretary Steve Reed said Tuesday it was "absolutely unacceptable" for women to have been excluded from a charity running event in a London park organised by a mosque.

title: Jharkhand Student Dies After Being Slapped By School Principal For Wearing Slippers: Cops
content: A class 12 student, who was allegedly slapped by the principal in-charge of her school for coming to the institute wearing a slipper a month ago in Jharkhand's Garhwa district, died in a hospital on Tuesday, police said.

title: AIADMK MP's "Free Wife" Comment Sparks Outrage
content: AIADMK MP C Ve Shanmugam has triggered a political storm with his controversial comment targeting Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin.

title: All-Time Deliveries Of Airbus A320 Top Boeing 737 For 1st Time
content: The Airbus A320 has overtaken the Boeing 737, the US aviation giant's single-aisle legacy aircraft, in terms of all-time deliveries for the first time, according to figures released Tuesday.

title: Amid Ceasefire, Israeli Forces Killed 6 Palestinians: Gaza Civil Defence
content: Gaza's civil defence agency said Israeli forces killed six Palestinians in separate incidents Tuesday, while the military reported its troops had opened fire on suspects who approached their positions.

title: Zubeen Garg Death Probe: 2 Key Witnesses From Singapore Appear Before Assam CID
content: Two more Assamese expats, who were present at the yacht party in Singapore during the final moments of legendary singer Zubeen Garg on September 19, appeared before the Assam Police's Criminal Investigation Department (CID) on Tuesday.

title: India To Resume Postal Services To US After Nearly Two-Month Suspension
content: India will resume all postal services to the United States from Wednesday after putting in place systems to collect duties upfront, the Department of Posts said.

title: Reunited Hostage Describes Stark Differences In Couple's Gaza Captivity
content: Former Israeli hostage Noa Argamani spoke out after her partner was released under the Gaza ceasefire deal, to describe the differences in their treatment in captivity in the Palestinian territory.

title: Focus on enterprises that can generate employment,  Kudumbashree women told
content: Minister for Local Self-government inaugurates Kerala Women’s Commission face-to-face programme on new opportunities for Kudumbashree women

title: 20 passengers burnt alive, 16 injured as bus catches fire in Jaisalmer; PM announces ex-gratia
content: Sixteen others injured in the blaze; Chief Minister Bhajan Lal Sharma rushes to the spot, cause of fire under investigation

title: Almost 60% of India’s elephants are in Karnataka, Assam, Tamil Nadu
content: The Wildlife Institute of India released the first-ever DNA-based synchronous estimation of elephants across the country

title: Supreme Court asks States to appoint nodal officers to trace missing children, upload details on Centre-run portal
content: The top court noted that despite the existence of a dedicated portal, there was hardly any dissemination of information among the stakeholders

title: Murmurs of dissent bedevil Youth Congress’s new leadership
content: Abin Varkey who was widely reckoned to become YC State chief requests YC national leadership to relieve him of his national duties as he prefers to work in the State

title: Centre rejects mining proposal in Tumakaru reserve forests
content: The regional office of the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MoEF&CC), Bengaluru, has rejected a proposal for diversion of 48.2 ha of forestland for a mining project in Tumakuru district

title: Andhra Pradesh launches landmark initiative to conserve 16 key wetlands: Pawan Kalyan
content: The initiative aims to protect vital wetlands, promote eco-tourism, safeguard rare species, and secure international recognition, showcasing Andhra Pradesh’s commitment to environmental conservation, he says

title: Nirmala Sitharaman says enabling environment for R&D, start-ups helped in retaining talent pool
content: The Union Finance Minister has said that such a space has been created after the transformation in the digital landscape in the last eight years

title: Central government staff protest over ‘inaction’ on workplace harassment allegations in Social Justice Ministry
content: CSS officers hold peace march and sit-in at Shastri Bhawan weeks after a Ministry official tried to kill himself ’s suicide attempt over alleged harassment.

title: Congress targets Modi after Trump hails Pakistan Army chief
content: Party says U.S. President ‘endorsing India’s enemies’ on global stage despite Modi’s claims of close friendship with Trump; it seeks answers from PM on why govt. failed to isolate Pakistan internationally

title: Dashboard to keep track of government litigation launched
content: The new feature under the Legal Information Management and Briefing System aims to improve transparency and coordination across Ministries, says Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal

title: Naidu trying to divert attention from fake liquor mafia, alleges Sajjala

content: His advocate said that a regular bail plea was pending before the Supreme Court, and so the top court would be the ‘proper’ forum to file the plea for interim relief as well

title: Kerala Waqf Board may seek legal remedy to expunge adverse comments in HC order
content: Board is facing the unique challenge of restoring its “organisational esteem” and legal relevance and defending its decision in the Munambam case in the wake of Division Bench of  Kerala High Court castigating it as a land grabber while declaring the holding as not a Waqf property

title: Taxpayers Association demands expedition of construction of second flyover in Ajith Singh Nagar
content: Thousands of labourers from Vambay Colony, Payakapuram, Ajith Singh Nagar, Rajarajeswari Peta commute everyday to the main city in search of work and this has lead to traffic congestions on the flyover, says association

title: State govt. librarian found dead in Malkhed after being depressed over unpaid salary
content: Her bereaved family members hold department officials responsible for her death and demand compensation and employment

title: Will not allow even an inch of Waqf land to be encroached, says A.P. Waqf Board Chairman
content: Chief Minister Nara Chandrababu Naidu has given me the responsibility to protect Waqf properties and under my chairmanship, encroachers, blackmailers, and miscreant realtors will have a tough time, says Abdul Aziz

title: Qatar Airways flight makes emergency landing in Ahmedabad
content: Technical inspections are underway to determine whether the aircraft can continue its journey to Hong Kong; if not, Qatar Airways will deploy an alternate aircraft to minimise delay for passengers, sources said.

title: Get advertisements pre-certified, EC tells parties ahead of Bihar polls
content: The poll panel told candidates to inform it about their authentic social media accounts; it said that monitoring committees will pre-certify advertisements of all political parties

title: Leaders welcome Google’s ₹87,520-crore AI hub in Visakhapatnam as boost to India’s digital growth
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi highlights the project as a major step toward building a developed India, democratising technology, and advancing AI innovation

content: The top court was hearing the State’s application to vacate its order granting former Telangana Special Intelligence Bureau chief Prabhakar Rao interim protection from arrest

content: ESPN analyst Kevin Pelton used simulation No. 620 to run through the NBA season from Opening Night to the Finals.

title: Calipari: Will retire before becoming 'transactional'
content: John Calipari has no plans to leave college basketball but said if he can no longer build relationships with players and do that job the way he wants, he'll exit the sport.

title: Ex-Jets star Mangold seeking kidney transplant
content: Former Jets center Nick Mangold, battling chronic kidney disease since a 2006 diagnosis for a rare genetic disorder, went public Tuesday with his need for a kidney transplant.

title: Skaggs' lawyer: Angels to blame for fatal overdose
content: A lawyer for Tyler Skaggs' family argued the Angels should be held responsible for his drug overdose death because the team failed to follow its own drug policies.

title: Rodgers, Flacco happy to be part of 'Icy Hot Bowl'
content: Thursday night's matchup between the Steelers and Bengals featuring Aaron Rodgers and Joe Flacco will mark just the second time in NFL history that opposing quarterbacks age 40 or older will start a regular or postseason game against each other.

title: Titans interim to stay positive for rookie QB Ward
content: Interim Titans coach Mike McCoy says he plans to clean up issues and use positive reinforcement to help guide rookie quarterback Cam Ward.

title: England beat Latvia to secure '26 World Cup spot
content: England booked their spot at the 2026 FIFA World Cup with a 5-0 thrashing of Latvia in qualifying on Tuesday.

title: Jones: Boys 'still in it,' open to defensive trade
content: Despite his team's uneven 2-3-1 start to the season, Cowboys owner Jerry Jones believes his team is "still in it," adding that Dallas is "in position to look at a trade" to help a struggling defense that is second to last in points allowed per game.

title: Ravens release veteran CJGJ 1 week after signing
content: The Ravens are releasing veteran safety C.J. Gardner-Johnson a week after signing him to their practice squad. He did not appear in a game for the team.

content: USMNT and USWNT fans often complain about high ticket prices, repetitive cities and weak opponents for games, but U.S. Soccer explains everything that goes into such decisions.

content: Meet the team of part-timers, ranked 150 by FIFA, hoping to reach next summer's tournament. "Every young boy wants to play in a World Cup, it is a dream... and we know we have a chance."

content: The Atlanta Falcons running back said interacting with James is extra special because the longtime NBA star is his favorite athlete.

content: Should the Dolphins or Ravens make coaching changes? Is it time for a QB switch for the Jets? Might the Eagles consider moves in their secondary?

content: Former unified welterweight champion scored a first-round TKO in his 154 pounds debut. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Neymar eyeing shock return to Europe
content: Santos forward Neymar is open to a move to Serie A amid links to Inter Milan and Napoli. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: CM, Health Minister to launch new 108 ambulances soon
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: BJP’s Bihar bet: Fresh faces, caste math, old challenges - decoding first candidate list
content: Facing anti-incumbency, the BJP has replaced several sitting MLAs in Bihar, fielding 71 candidates for the upcoming polls. The party's first list prioritizes a mix of fresh faces and experienced leaders, balancing social justice with strategic political considerations across various caste groups. Prominent figures and new contenders feature in this crucial selection.

title: Trump considering terminating business with China; threatens to end cooking oil trade
content: President Trump accused China of "purposefully" halting soybean purchases, labeling it an "economically hostile act." He stated the US is considering trade termination with Beijing as retribution, emphasizing domestic cooking oil production capabilities. This move follows China's previous use of trade leverage, impacting American soybean farmers.

title: 'I can also play': Shami fires back at Ajit Agarkar after Australia ODIs snub
content: Mohammed Shami, India's World Cup star, joined Bengal's Ranji practice, addressing his white-ball series exclusion. He dismissed fitness concerns, stating his presence for Bengal proves his readiness for longer formats. Shami emphasized that selection decisions lie with the selectors, not him, and he awaits updates from the NCA.

title: Google has a new 'Work From Home' rule: Employees can't use…
content: Google has significantly restricted its "Work From Anywhere" policy, limiting employee flexibility. Workers can no longer use WFA days to work from home or different Google offices. The policy, now intended for week-long increments, aims to return to its original intent, impacting employees who valued pandemic-era remote freedom.

title: Gaza: Hamas posts video of public execution; 4 hostages’ remains return to Israel
content: Hamas executed men branded collaborators amidst street clashes. A US-brokered truce is in effect. Israel confirmed the return of more hostage remains. Hamas security units are patrolling Gaza. US President Donald Trump vowed to disarm Hamas.  A peace plan calls for a demilitarised Gaza. Families continue to press for the return of all hostages.

title: US targets suspected drug-terror vessel off Venezuela; six killed in strike, Trump says — Watch
content: President Trump announced a lethal strike off the coast of Venezuela, killing six individuals on a vessel affiliated with a "Designated Terrorist Organization" allegedly involved in narcotrafficking. The strike, ordered by the Secretary of War, occurred in international waters and marks the fifth fatal operation in the Caribbean under the administration's policy of treating drug traffickers as unlawful combatants.

title: Rare earth curbs: US calls India key ally in 'China vs world' battle; seeks 'support'
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent accused China of "provocative" economic moves after Beijing tightened rare earth mineral export controls. He stated the US and allies will respond collectively to China's "weaponization" of its dominance in these vital materials, asserting sovereignty and de-risking supply chains.

title: Grammy-winning R&B singer D'Angelo passes away at 51
content: The world mourns the loss of D'Angelo, the Grammy-winning R&B artist whose haunting melodies and rich lyrical storytelling redefined neo-soul. At just 51, he succumbed to cancer, leaving behind a memorable catalog that includes classics like 'Untitled (How Does It Feel)' and 'Brown Sugar.' A beloved father, his influence resonates through generations of musicians and fans alike.

title: Amazon, Nvidia and Tesla hit as Trump's China Tariff wipes $770 bn in biggest single day fall
content: Major tech companies experienced their worst single-day losses since April, with Amazon, Nvidia, and Tesla leading a $770 billion market capitalization wipeout. President Trump's threat of 100% tariffs on Chinese goods and export controls on critical software triggered significant drops across the tech and cryptocurrency markets.

title: Digital rights debate: SC rejects doctor’s WhatsApp plea; suggests using Zoho’s Arattai
content: India's Supreme Court has ruled that access to private messaging platforms like WhatsApp is not a fundamental right. The court dismissed a doctor's plea to restore her blocked account, emphasizing users must adhere to platform policies. It suggested alternatives like Zoho's Arattai app, which has seen a surge in popularity.

title: Gabrielle Union reflects on redefining survival after rape at 19
content: Gabrielle Union, wife of NBA icon Dwyane Wade, bravely shared her experience as a rape survivor during an interview. She discussed societal perceptions of victims and her personal journey, emphasizing that while she strives to be a survivor, there are days she resides in a victim space, relying on others for inspiration.

title: Did Mahomes boycott Bad Bunny for Charlie Kirk? Truth explained
content: Viral claims that Patrick Mahomes would boycott the 2026 Super Bowl over Bad Bunny's halftime show and join Turning Point USA are false. Mahomes has made no such statements regarding Bad Bunny or the political group. His wife, Brittany, made a general comment about hate after Charlie Kirk's death, but Mahomes himself remains apolitical.

title: Rebecca J fires back at Offset with claim about Stefon Diggs, Cardi B
content: Rapper Offset faced backlash after implying Instagram model Rebecca J pursued him. Rebecca J responded strongly, calling Offset's actions embarrassing and defending Cardi B. She praised Cardi as self-made and referenced NFL player Stefon Diggs in a viral comment. The internet reacted to Rebecca J's defense and sharp retort, highlighting her confidence and willingness to respond.

title: Jack Roslovic reportedly lost nearly $10M before signing with Oilers
content: Jack Roslovic rejected a significant three-year offer from the Edmonton Oilers. He sought a more lucrative deal elsewhere but remained unsigned for months. The Oilers later offered a one-year contract. Roslovic now aims to impress this season to secure a better deal next summer. This situation highlights the unpredictable nature of NHL contracts.

title: Low magnesium: The silent cause behind your poor sleep, anxiety and fatigue
content: Millions of people worldwide struggle with low magnesium, often without realizing it. The deficiency can lead to poor sleep, anxiety, and fatigue. It’s one of the most overlooked nutrients today.

title: 'Phase 2 begins right now': Trump on Gaza peace deal; demands dead hostages from Hamas
content: Following a hostage swap, former President Trump urged for a "phase 2" of negotiations, stating the "job is not done" as dead hostages have not been returned. Israel announced plans to cut aid to Gaza by half, citing Hamas's alleged ceasefire violations by delaying the return of deceased hostages.

title: Aaron Rodgers, Joe Flacco clash in rare over-40 QB duel on Thursday Night Football
content: A rare NFL showdown features veteran quarterbacks Aaron Rodgers, 41, and Joe Flacco, 40, facing off. Flacco, recently traded to the Bengals, impressed in his debut, showcasing his enduring skills. This historic matchup, only the third of its kind, pits two seasoned leaders against each other, adding significant strategic depth to Thursday Night Football.

title: Pakistan’s 'sharm' offensive: Will again nominate Trump for Nobel
content: Pakistan's Prime Minister Shahbaz Sharif renewed his country's nomination of Donald Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize, praising his intervention in the India-Pakistan conflict. Trump, visibly pleased, joked about returning home after the praise. The event also saw some diplomatic gaffes and criticism of Trump's focus on self-praise.

title: Chips to ships: China just weaponized the sea - Xi ups ante against Trump
content: China has imposed sanctions on US subsidiaries of South Korean shipbuilding giant Hanwha Ocean, escalating the trade war. This move, alongside US port fees on Chinese ships, signals a broader fight over maritime dominance. Both nations are leveraging their shipbuilding capabilities and port access as new fronts in the ongoing economic conflict.

title: Cops rule out gang-rape in Durgapur medical student assault case; arrest victim's friend
content: West Bengal police have ruled out gang-rape in the Durgapur medical student assault case, stating one of the five arrested accused committed sexual assault. The involvement of others is under investigation, with the victim's friend also being questioned. Evidence collection, including scene reconstruction and forensic analysis, is ongoing.

title: Ayesha Curry marks Canadian Thanksgiving amid Stephen Curry remark backlash
content: While Stephen Curry leads the Warriors in preseason, his wife Ayesha is celebrating Canadian Thanksgiving, steering clear of recent marital life criticism.  Previously, her candid remarks on marriage on a podcast sparked online debate, though she now emphasizes her deep love for Stephen and their swift decision to marry at 22.

title: Haryana IPS 'suicide' case: Another death and a 'sacrifice' - what ASI said in his last video
content: A police officer's family refused to hand over his body after his death, taking it to their village. This follows the suicide of a senior officer who accused 16 officials of harassment. The Haryana government has made administrative changes and amended the FIR to include SC/ST Act provisions following a request from the deceased officer's wife.

title: IND vs AUS: Hitman mania! Rohit Sharma arrives in Delhi, fans flock for selfies
content: Cricket star Rohit Sharma has arrived in Delhi for India's upcoming ODI series against Australia. This marks his return to international cricket after a significant physical transformation. Sharma underwent intensive training sessions, showcasing his batting prowess. The series begins on October 19 in Perth. Fans eagerly await his comeback in the blue jersey.

title: US jobs concern: Powell sees rising unemployment risks; Fed may cut rates twice more this year
content: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell indicated potential further interest rate cuts this year due to a slowing US job market, suggesting two more reductions are possible. He acknowledged concerns about employment risks outweighing inflation, and hinted at an end to the Fed's balance sheet reduction. Powell also defended past pandemic-era asset purchases, admitting they could have concluded sooner.

title: IPS officer 'suicide' case: Another Haryana cop shoots self; records final video
content: A Haryana police officer, Sandeep Lather, allegedly committed suicide, accusing Inspector General Y Puran Kumar of corruption in a video. Lather's death follows Kumar's own alleged suicide, where he named several officers. The incident has led to internal investigations and administrative changes within the Haryana police department.

title: 'Pak casualties along LoC over 100': DGMO Lt Gen Rajiv Ghai on Operation Sindoor - watch
content: India's Director General Military Operations revealed Operation Sindoor, a precise military response to the Pahalgam terror attack, resulted in over 100 Pakistani casualties. This operation, a blend of military action and diplomatic strategy, also saw the Indus Water Treaty temporarily suspended. The successful termination of the three perpetrators after a 96-day pursuit highlights India's commitment to justice.

title: Rajasthan: Bus travelling from Jaisalmer to Jodhpur catches fire; casualties reported
content: A private bus traveling from Jaisalmer to Jodhpur caught fire near Thaiyat village, resulting in multiple casualties. The bus, which departed Jaisalmer around 3 pm, was engulfed in flames shortly after smoke was seen from its rear. Rescue operations are ongoing, and the injured have been rushed to Jawahir Hospital.

title: How fire crackers can damage baby lungs this festive season
content: Festivals in India bring joy with fireworks, but the smoke poses serious dangers to babies. Their developing lungs are highly vulnerable to pollutants like PM2.5 and heavy metals. Studies show a dramatic rise in air pollution during festivals, impacting infant health. Parents must take precautions to protect their little ones.

title: LG’s stellar listing: $13 bn giant more valuable than South Korean parent! Top 5 takeaways
content: LG Electronics India has achieved a remarkable stock market debut. The company's shares opened with a 50% premium, significantly exceeding its issue price. This strong performance has propelled its market valuation past its South Korean parent company.

title: Four-time Grammy winner D’Angelo dies at 51 after battling cancer
content: R&B icon D'Angelo, born Michael Eugene Archer, has died at 51 after a battle with cancer. A pioneer of neo-soul, he released three Grammy-winning albums, including "Brown Sugar" and "Voodoo." His career was marked by innovative music and a memorable performance in the "Untitled (How Does It Feel)" video.

title: Mahomes surprises Andrews with unexpected public message after Chiefs win
content: Brittany Mahomes garnered attention following the Kansas City Chiefs' victory by showcasing her support for Erin Andrews' fashion line, WEAR by Erin Andrews. She posted a photo of her outfit from the brand on Instagram, thanking Andrews directly. This gesture highlights the growing trend of NFL partners promoting women's sports apparel.

title: 'Historic low’: US drops out of top 10 most powerful passports list!
content: For the first time in two decades, the US passport has fallen out of the top 10 most powerful, now sharing 12th place with Malaysia. This decline, attributed to various access restrictions and an inward-looking policy, contrasts with China's significant gains in global mobility and influence.

title: Delhi-NCR pollution: GRAP stage-1 curbs imposed after air quality hits 'poor' category
content: The commission for air quality management has activated Stage-I of the graded response action plan in Delhi-NCR. This action follows a drop in the air quality index to the 'poor' category. Forecasts predict continued poor air quality. All implementing agencies will intensify measures to prevent further deterioration. Citizens are urged to follow the citizen charter.

title: 'Tough for Shubman Gill ... ': Gautam Gambhir opens up ahead of ODI series vs Australia
content: India head coach Gautam Gambhir lauded Shubman Gill, stating he has already passed his toughest captaincy test in England. Gambhir emphasised that Gill earned the dressing room's respect by "saying and doing the right things," highlighting his leadership during the recent Test series win.

title: The race to the 2026 World Cup: Six more teams book their place at the finals
content: all confederations are drawing to a close, but we're still a long way from discovering the full list of 45 nations that will join hosts United States , Mexico and Canada to make up the field of 48 . the final two rounds of the group stage were played, when we discovered the seven nations that joined Morocco and Tunisia, plus interconfederation playoff contenders .

title: 14 can't-miss games to watch this November
content: it's a new era of sorts in examining the nonconference portion of the men's college basketball season . a diminished slate of traditional MTEs along with ever-expanding league schedules have combined to change the cadence of marquee matchups . the Big East has done away with both the Gavitt Games (vs. Big Ten) and a mini-challenge against the Big 12 .

title: What does Brian Callahan's firing mean for Cam Ward, 1-5 Titans?
content: the Titans fired coach Brian Callahan six games into the season . callahan worked with the likes of peyton Manning, Matthew Stafford , Derek Carr and Joe Burrow . the former Cincinnati Bengals offensive coordinator finished with a 3-14 record in his first season with second-year quarterback .

title: Ashley Tellis, Mumbai-born US thinktanker under Justice Department lens for China links
content: a federal court has issued a search warrant for Tellis's home in Vienna . a raid by the FBI had located thousands of pages of classified documents in the house . the development shocked the city’s think=tank community given the respect Tellis commanded for his work in the US-India-China domain as a scholar .

title: 'Sitting in BJP’s lap': Lone attacks Omar; says he pushed Congress out of RS polls at BJP’s behest
content: Sajad Gani Lone says he will abstain from voting in next week's elections . he accuses CM Omar Abdullah of pushing Congress out of the contest . Lone said he would have supported a secular candidate, but was on a trip to please BJP .

title: Only Hindu temple in East England to close: Council puts building on sale; community fears loss
content: the Bharat Hindu Samaj Temple was established in the new England complex in Peterborough in 1984 . it serves 13,500 Hindus in Cambridgeshire, Norfolk and parts of Lincolnshire . the temple put in its bid by the deadline of Monday night to buy the entire complex of seven units .

title: Legal breaks: Off-roading hits roadblock in Kashmir; FIR against social media influencer
content: police in central Kashmir registered the case under Indian Forest Act against Imad-ur-Rehman . a video surfaced showing youngsters driving Thar vehicles in the ecologically sensitive Brenwar forests of Pir Panjal mountains . the case was filed on a complaint from the forest department and several high-powered Mahindra Thar vehic .

title: Soaring silver price takes sheen off Diwali sweets as traders skimp on foil
content: the price of a silver varakh has gone up to Rs 8 from Rs 5 last Diwali . it's a bittersweet moment for shops as it comes amid cheer over reduction in GST on sweets to 5% . the cost of the sweets it buys has shot up 10-15% .

title: Russia India’s top oil supplier: Moscow accounts for 34% of shipments in Sept; 10% dip in 2025
content: india’s crude imports in Sept at more than 4.5 million bpd (barrels per day) . this is an increase of 70,000 barrels over Aug, but flat when compared to the year-ago period . shipments have seen a drop of 180,000 from the average volumes imported during the first eight months .

title: LoC: Security forces foil infiltration bid in Kupwara; two terrorists gunned down
content: security forces foiled an infiltration bid along the Line of Control (LoC) in Kupwara district’s Keran sector . a large cache of weapons and equipment was seized from the site of the encounter . on October 13 evening, a joint team of the Army and J&K police had launched an anti-terror operation in Machhal sector based on intelligence inputs .
